description.narrative: Facing Finance e.V. is a non-profit Research organisation headquartered in Berlin that takes a stand against corporate violations in the areas of environment and climate change, labour and human rights, corruption, and weapons that are against international law. Since 2016, the organization is leading the Fair Finance coalition in Germany, which researches the level of integration of ESG criteria in the policies and practices of major German banks who are active on national and/or regional level. The research results arepublished and used to inform the general public, and bank clients specifically, mainly through social and conventional media, as well as participation in Annual Share Holder meetings and specific events, where the public is interested in sustainability issues. FFGermany provides awareness raising and stimulates bank clients to take action by sending comments to their bank (either demanding improvements, praising their conduct or indicating that they will change their account toanother bank). The coalition uses the research results also to engage with the banks directly and to influence the government and financial authorities where stricter (application of ) regulation is needed. The FFG coalition works in close cooperation with other FF coalitions in Europe and Southern countries. Sida FFI funding will be phased out and end in 2022.

participating-org.narrative: Facing Finance is the lead organization convening the other members of the FFG Germany core group. The organization is known for being active as a civil society watchdog monitoring the corporate and financial sectors in Germany, and as an engaged actor at the European level. Facing Finance coordinates regular reports on human rights and environmental violations of companies and financial institutions, published under the title Dirty Profits (see: http://www.facing-finance.org/en/die-kampagne/facing-finance-e-v/)
